---
title: Tectospinal Tract 
---

The Tectospinal tract is part of the [medial motor systems ]({{< var ref-medial-motor-systems.path >}})

![Somatotopic organization of medial and lateral motor system Projections to Anterior Horn Cells @blumenfeldNeuroanatomyClinicalCases2022](/The Archive/Neuroscience/Neuroanatomy/Tracts/images/fig.6.7 Blumenfeld somatotopic organization of medial and lateral motor systems.png)

# Pathway

## Origin/input

[Superior Colliculus]({{< var ref-superior-colliculus.path >}})

## Pathway

The tectospinal tract exits the superior colliculus and its tectospinal fibers travel superiorly through the tectum of the brainstem

Decussation: Dorsal tegmentum of the midbrain


The tectospinal tract terminates at the cerviccal cord

![Somatotopic organization of medial and lateral motor system Projections to Anterior Horn Cells @blumenfeldNeuroanatomyClinicalCases2022](/The Archive/Neuroscience/Neuroanatomy/Tracts/images/fig.6.7 Blumenfeld somatotopic organization of medial and lateral motor systems.png)

## Output/termination

The tectospinal tract terminates in the cervical cord



# Function

Coordination of head and eye movements 

:::{.callout-caution}
The function of the tectospinal tract is uncertain in humans @blumenfeldNeuroanatomyClinicalCases2022
:::
